# rivanna.dev

> effortless GPU computing on UVA's Rivanna cluster

rv is a CLI tool for running GPU jobs on UVA's Rivanna HPC cluster. no SLURM scripts, no partition guessing, one command to submit.

## docs

- [getting started](https://rivanna.dev/docs/getting-started.md): install rv, set up SSH, run your first job
- [commands](https://rivanna.dev/docs/commands.md): full reference for all 15 rv commands
- [smart allocator](https://rivanna.dev/docs/allocator.md): how fan-out strategy and backfill detection work
- [configuration](https://rivanna.dev/docs/configuration.md): config file reference (~/.rv/config.toml)
- [guides](https://rivanna.dev/docs/gpu-training.md): tips, gotchas, queue times, GPU training best practices, troubleshooting
- [changelog](https://rivanna.dev/docs/changelog.md): version history and release notes
